III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Development of service plans
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418
Section (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
Description and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency failed to complete a timely service plan.
Investigation On 4/4/24 DCWL received information from Complainant,
indicating the Initial Service Plan (ISP) for Child A had not been
completed or provided to the parents. Complainant indicated the
court ordered the ISP be filed within 30 days. Complainant stated
Child A was placed in care on 2/20/24.
DCWL Area Manager was contacted on 4/4/24 via TEAMS. It
was determined the investigation would focus on ISP timeliness,
as court orders are not regulated by DCWL, and timeliness of
providing an ISP to parents is not addressed in licensing rules.
Chief Administrator was contacted on 4/4/24 via email. Chief
Administrator(CA) was informed of the allegation and offered a
phone call to discuss further. CA emailed a response on 4/5/24. A
follow-up email was sent to CA on 4/11/24 regarding the findings
of the investigation.
Documents reviewed
Child Aâ€™s case record was reviewed in MiSACWIS. Per a court
order dated 2/23/24, Child A entered care on 2/23/24. Therefore,
an ISP would have been due by 3/24/24. An ISP was located in
the file, dated 3/22/24. The timestamp in MiSACWIS verified the
report was completed and routed for approval on 3/22/24.
Analysis Based on a review of documents in the foster care file, the initial
service plan was completed within the required timeframe.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
